I've set my Thrustmaster Joystick in KSP input settings, but it's axes only work halfway, the thrust only throttles up to half of the axis motion, and as soon as it passes the first half it goes back to idle, and pitch and roll are stuck in one end while I keep the joystick in the center position

however, I've set one of my POV axes to Yaw and it works perfectly

I've already calibrated it in windows, and it's the same joystick I used for years in FSX, so either I'm missing something or it isn't compatible with KSP

I haven't tried in a clean install yet though, but I might

I ended up using this mod which works very well and is much better than the stock.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95022-0-90-AFBW-v1-5-1-(Joystick-controller-mod-we-re-back!)

You need an updated dll which is near the end of the thread http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95022-0-90-AFBW-v1-5-1-%28Joystick-controller-mod-we-re-back%21%29?p=1901187&viewfull=1#post1901187

Only problem with it is it causes an issue with rover wheels accelerating constantly.
